function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential migration of aerosols from patient rooms into higher traffic corridors, increasing the risk of spreading airborne pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Involuntary exposure of room occupants to airborne pathogens from occupants of the corridor space due to negative pressure differentials.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drawbacks of anterooms in pe or aii rooms, including increased floor area, travel distance, and visual barrier between patients and care teams.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of general facility design for different patient conditions and operational requirements may lead to increased risk of viral transmission within the hospital or healthcare facility.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in the number of individuals contracting covid-19 and being exposed to sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of filtration techniques against pathogens such as sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes required after original publication","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Viral particles too small for best filters","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imperfect filter systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear acknowledgment of contributors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Downloading from an unsecured website","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 virus through droplets and fomites","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne spread of sars-cov-2 virus during aerosol-generating procedures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertain role of the faecal-oral route in sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental sampling conducted in an airborne infectious-disease zone in a hospital.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of bioaerosol samplers in a hospital environment can lead to potential aerosolized pathogen exposure.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of dedicated covid-19 patient hospital infrastructure","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in patient rooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient air-cleaning routes in the airborne infectious-disease zone","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the corridor","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative pressure in the ward","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and disinfection schedule","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High number of positive air and surface samples indicating potential contamination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive samples from isolation rooms indicate potential spread of the virus to other areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Toilet identified as the most contaminated environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of viral particles in bathroom surfaces and aerosols","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of hands during toilet usage","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generation of bio-aerosols in drainage stacks after toilet flushing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination and spread of viruses in the toilet area due to shared use by multiple patients, potentially leading to a higher risk of infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer rate of viruses from smooth to rough surfaces may contribute to contamination in the toilet area.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of positive samples in the toilet area and potential presence of sars-cov-2 in patient stool samples present an increased risk of viral spread in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Leakage of aerosols from isolation rooms to the corridor","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of weakly positive virus in corridor air and on exhaust grilles","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low airborne concentration of sars-cov-2 in the hospital","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of aerosols in the bathroom","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 in an air-outlet fan","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small number of collected air samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor air-temperature and relative humidity within a range favorable for microbial growth.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-standardized data collection and terminology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges of data sharing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Timely generation and dissemination of data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease transmission through primary data collection and sharing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Perception of science and research funding","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Possibility of incomplete data capture due to studies not using specified search terms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential for transmission of covid-19 in the process of real-world evidence research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate categorization of study topics and designs leading to misinterpretation of data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large-scale data collection and sharing may lead to potential privacy breaches and data security risks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate morbidity and mortality of specific ethnic populations increases the risk of social and healthcare inequalities.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaborative data sharing across multiple countries may lead to cross-border legal and regulatory challenges.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited coverage of commercial covid-19 ehr data in regions outside north america","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
